ClientID.description: A client-provided identifier, used by clients to refer to their Orders or Trades with an identifier that they have provided.

ClientTag.description: A client-provided tag that can contain any data and may be assigned to their Orders or Trades. Tags are typically used to associate groups of Trades and/or Orders together.

ClientComment.description: A client-provided comment that can contain any data and may be assigned to their Orders or Trades. Comments are typically used to provide extra context or meaning to an Order or Trade.

ClientExtensions.description: A ClientExtensions object allows a client to attach a clientID, tag and comment to Orders and Trades in their Account.  Do not set, modify, or delete this field if your account is associated with MT4.

id.description: The Client ID of the Order/Trade

tag.description: A tag associated with the Order/Trade

comment.description: A comment associated with the Order/Trade

TakeProfitDetails.description: TakeProfitDetails specifies the details of a Take Profit Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Take Profit, or when a Trade's dependent Take Profit Order is modified directly through the Trade.

price.description: The price that the Take Profit Order will be triggered at.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Take Profit Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Take Profit Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

clientExtensions.description: The Client Extensions to add to the Take Profit Order when created.

StopLossDetails.description: StopLossDetails specifies the details of a Stop Loss Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Stop Loss, or when a Trade's dependent Stop Loss Order is modified directly through the Trade.

price.description: The price that the Stop Loss Order will be triggered at.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Stop Loss Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Stop Loss Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

clientExtensions.description: The Client Extensions to add to the Stop Loss Order when created.

TrailingStopLossDetails.description: TrailingStopLossDetails specifies the details of a Trailing Stop Loss Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Trailing Stop Loss, or when a Trade's dependent Trailing Stop Loss Order is modified directly through the Trade.

distance.description: The distance (in price units) from the Trade's fill price that the Trailing Stop Loss Order will be triggered at.
distance.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Trailing Stop Loss Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Trailing Stop Loss Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

clientExtensions.description: The Client Extensions to add to the Trailing Stop Loss Order when created.

TradeOpen.description: A TradeOpen object represents a Trade for an instrument that was opened in an Account. It is found embedded in Transactions that affect the position of an instrument in the Account, specifically the OrderFill Transaction.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that was opened
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

units.description: The number of units opened by the Trade
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

clientExtensions.description: The client extensions for the newly opened Trade

TradeReduce.description: A TradeReduce object represents a Trade for an instrument that was reduced (either partially or fully) in an Account. It is found embedded in Transactions that affect the position of an instrument in the account, specifically the OrderFill Transaction.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that was reduced or closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

units.description: The number of units that the Trade was reduced by
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

realizedPL.description: The PL realized when reducing the Trade
realizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

financing.description: The financing paid/collected when reducing the Trade
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

MarketOrderTradeClose.description: A MarketOrderTradeClose specifies the extensions to a Market Order that has been created specifically to close a Trade.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade requested to be closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

clientTradeID.description: The client ID of the Trade requested to be closed

units.description: Indication of how much of the Trade to close. Either "ALL", or a DecimalNumber reflection a partial close of the Trade.

MarketOrderMarginCloseout.description: Details for the Market Order extensions specific to a Market Order placed that is part of a Market Order Margin Closeout in a client's account

reason.description: The reason the Market Order was created to perform a margin closeout

MarketOrderMarginCloseoutReason.description: The reason that the Market Order was created to perform a margin closeout

MarketOrderDelayedTradeClose.description: Details for the Market Order extensions specific to a Market Order placed with the intent of fully closing a specific open trade that should have already been closed but wasn't due to halted market conditions

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade being closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

clientTradeID.description: The Client ID of the Trade being closed
clientTradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

sourceTransactionID.description: The Transaction ID of the DelayedTradeClosure transaction to which this Delayed Trade Close belongs to
sourceTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

MarketOrderPositionCloseout.description: A MarketOrderPositionCloseout specifies the extensions to a Market Order when it has been created to closeout a specific Position.

instrument.description: The instrument of the Position being closed out.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: Indication of how much of the Position to close. Either "ALL", or a DecimalNumber reflection a partial close of the Trade. The DecimalNumber must always be positive, and represent a number that doesn't exceed the absolute size of the Position.

VWAPReceipt.description: A VWAP Receipt provides a record of how the price for an Order fill is constructed. If the Order is filled with multiple buckets in a depth of market, each bucket will be represented with a VWAP Receipt.

units.description: The number of units filled
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: The price at which the units were filled
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

LiquidityRegenerationSchedule.description: A LiquidityRegenerationSchedule indicates how liquidity that is used when filling an Order for an instrument is regenerated following the fill.  A liquidity regeneration schedule will be in effect until the timestamp of its final step, but may be replaced by a schedule created for an Order of the same instrument that is filled while it is still in effect.

steps.description: The steps in the Liquidity Regeneration Schedule

LiquidityRegenerationScheduleStep.description: A liquidity regeneration schedule Step indicates the amount of bid and ask liquidity that is used by the Account at a certain time. These amounts will only change at the timestamp of the following step.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the schedule step.
timestamp.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

bidLiquidityUsed.description: The amount of bid liquidity used at this step in the schedule.
bidLiquidityUsed.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

askLiquidityUsed.description: The amount of ask liquidity used at this step in the schedule.
askLiquidityUsed.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

OpenTradeFinancing.description: OpenTradeFinancing is used to pay/collect daily financing charge for an open Trade within an Account

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that financing is being paid/collected for.
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

financing.description: The amount of financing paid/collected for the Trade.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

PositionFinancing.description: OpenTradeFinancing is used to pay/collect daily financing charge for a Position within an Account

instrumentID.description: The instrument of the Position that financing is being paid/collected for.
instrumentID.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

financing.description: The amount of financing paid/collected for the Position.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

openTradeFinancings.description: The financing paid/collecte for each open Trade within the Position.

TransactionRejectReason.description: The reason that a Transaction was rejected.

TransactionFilter.description: A filter that can be used when fetching Transactions

TransactionHeartbeat.description: A TransactionHeartbeat object is injected into the Transaction stream to ensure that the HTTP connection remains active.

type.description: The string "HEARTBEAT"

lastTransactionID.description: The ID of the most recent Transaction created for the Account
lastTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

time.description: The date/time when the TransactionHeartbeat was created.
time.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

Price.description: The specification of an Account-specific Price.

type.description: The string "PRICE". Used to identify the a Price object when found in a stream.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

time.description: The date/time when the Price was created
time.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

bids.description: The list of prices and liquidity available on the Instrument's bid side. It is possible for this list to be empty if there is no bid liquidity currently available for the Instrument in the Account.

asks.description: The list of prices and liquidity available on the Instrument's ask side. It is possible for this list to be empty if there is no ask liquidity currently available for the Instrument in the Account.

closeoutBid.description: The closeout bid Price. This Price is used when a bid is required to closeout a Position (margin closeout or manual) yet there is no bid liquidity. The closeout bid is never used to open a new position.
closeoutBid.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

closeoutAsk.description: The closeout ask Price. This Price is used when a ask is required to closeout a Position (margin closeout or manual) yet there is no ask liquidity. The closeout ask is never used to open a new position.
closeoutAsk.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

quoteHomeConversionFactors.description: The factors used to convert quantities of this price's Instrument's quote currency into a quantity of the Account's home currency.

unitsAvailable.description: Representation of many units of an Instrument are available to be traded for both long and short Orders.

PriceValue.description: The string representation of a Price for an Instrument.
PriceValue.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

PriceBucket.description: A Price Bucket represents a price available for an amount of liquidity

price.description: The Price offered by the PriceBucket
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

liquidity.description: The amount of liquidity offered by the PriceBucket

UnitsAvailable.description: Representation of many units of an Instrument are available to be traded for both long and short Orders.

long.description: The units available breakdown for long Orders.

short.description: The units available breakdown for short Orders.

UnitsAvailableDetails.description: Representation of how many units of an Instrument are available to be traded by an Order depending on its postionFill option.

default.description: The number of units that are available to be traded using an Order with a positionFill option of "DEFAULT". For an Account with hedging enabled, this value will be the same as the "OPEN_ONLY" value. For an Account without hedging enabled, this value will be the same as the "REDUCE_FIRST" value.
default.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

reduceFirst.description: The number of units that may are available to be traded with an Order with a positionFill option of "REDUCE_FIRST".
reduceFirst.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

reduceOnly.description: The number of units that may are available to be traded with an Order with a positionFill option of "REDUCE_ONLY".
reduceOnly.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

openOnly.description: The number of units that may are available to be traded with an Order with a positionFill option of "OPEN_ONLY".
openOnly.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

QuoteHomeConversionFactors.description: QuoteHomeConversionFactors represents the factors that can be used used to convert quantities of a Price's Instrument's quote currency into the Account's home currency.

positiveUnits.description: The factor used to convert a positive amount of the Price's Instrument's quote currency into a positive amount of the Account's home currency.  Conversion is performed by multiplying the quote units by the conversion factor.
positiveUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

negativeUnits.description: The factor used to convert a negative amount of the Price's Instrument's quote currency into a negative amount of the Account's home currency.  Conversion is performed by multiplying the quote units by the conversion factor.
negativeUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

PricingHeartbeat.description: A PricingHeartbeat object is injected into the Pricing stream to ensure that the HTTP connection remains active.

type.description: The string "HEARTBEAT"

time.description: The date/time when the Heartbeat was created.
time.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

DecimalNumber.description: The string representation of a decimal number.
DecimalNumber.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

AccountUnits.description: The string representation of a quantity of an Account's home currency.
AccountUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

Currency.description: Currency name identifier. Used by clients to refer to currencies.
Currency.format: A string containing an ISO 4217 currency (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

InstrumentName.description: Instrument name identifier. Used by clients to refer to an Instrument.
InstrumentName.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

name.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

type.description: The type of the Instrument

displayName.description: The display name of the Instrument

pipLocation.description: The location of the "pip" for this instrument. The decimal position of the pip in this Instrument's price can be found at 10 ^ pipLocation (e.g. -4 pipLocation results in a decimal pip position of 10 ^ -4 = 0.0001).

displayPrecision.description: The number of decimal places that should be used to display prices for this instrument. (e.g. a displayPrecision of 5 would result in a price of "1" being displayed as "1.00000")

tradeUnitsPrecision.description: The amount of decimal places that may be provided when specifying the number of units traded for this instrument.

minimumTradeSize.description: The smallest number of units allowed to be traded for this instrument.
minimumTradeSize.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

maximumTrailingStopDistance.description: The maximum trailing stop distance allowed for a trailing stop loss created for this instrument. Specified in price units.
maximumTrailingStopDistance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

minimumTrailingStopDistance.description: The minimum trailing stop distance allowed for a trailing stop loss created for this instrument. Specified in price units.
minimumTrailingStopDistance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

maximumPositionSize.description: The maximum position size allowed for this instrument. Specified in units.
maximumPositionSize.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

maximumOrderUnits.description: The maximum units allowed for an Order placed for this instrument. Specified in units.
maximumOrderUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

marginRate.description: The margin rate for this instrument.
marginRate.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

DateTime.description: Representation of a date and time value.
DateTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

TradeID.description: The Trade's identifier, unique within the Trade's Account.
TradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

TradeState.description: The current state of the Trade.

TradeSpecifier.description: The identification of a Trade as referred to by clients
TradeSpecifier.format: Either the Trade's OANDA-assigned TradeID or the Trade's client-provided ClientID prefixed by the "@" symbol

Trade.description: The specification of a Trade within an Account. This includes the full representation of the Trade's dependent Orders in addition to the IDs of those Orders.

id.description: The Trade's identifier, unique within the Trade's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

price.description: The execution price of the Trade.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

openTime.description: The date/time when the Trade was opened.
openTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

state.description: The current state of the Trade.

initialUnits.description: The initial size of the Trade. Negative values indicate a short Trade, and positive values indicate a long Trade.
initialUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

currentUnits.description: The number of units currently open for the Trade. This value is reduced to 0.0 as the Trade is closed.
currentUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

realizedPL.description: The total profit/loss realized on the closed portion of the Trade.
realizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

unrealizedPL.description: The unrealized profit/loss on the open portion of the Trade.
unrealizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

closingTransactionIDs.description: The IDs of the Transactions that have closed portions of this Trade.

financing.description: The financing paid/collected for this Trade.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

closeTime.description: The date/time when the Trade was fully closed. Only provided for Trades whose state is CLOSED.
closeTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

clientExtensions.description: The client extensions of the Trade.

takeProfitOrder.description: Full representation of the Trade's Take Profit Order, only provided if such an Order exists.

stopLossOrder.description: Full representation of the Trade's Stop Loss Order, only provided if such an Order exists.

trailingStopLossOrder.description: Full representation of the Trade's Trailing Stop Loss Order, only provided if such an Order exists.

TradeSummary.description: The summary of a Trade within an Account. This representation does not provide the full details of the Trade's dependent Orders.

id.description: The Trade's identifier, unique within the Trade's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

price.description: The execution price of the Trade.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

openTime.description: The date/time when the Trade was opened.
openTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

state.description: The current state of the Trade.

initialUnits.description: The initial size of the Trade. Negative values indicate a short Trade, and positive values indicate a long Trade.
initialUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

currentUnits.description: The number of units currently open for the Trade. This value is reduced to 0.0 as the Trade is closed.
currentUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

realizedPL.description: The total profit/loss realized on the closed portion of the Trade.
realizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

unrealizedPL.description: The unrealized profit/loss on the open portion of the Trade.
unrealizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

closingTransactionIDs.description: The IDs of the Transactions that have closed portions of this Trade.

financing.description: The financing paid/collected for this Trade.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

closeTime.description: The date/time when the Trade was fully closed. Only provided for Trades whose state is CLOSED.
closeTime.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

clientExtensions.description: The client extensions of the Trade.

takeProfitOrderID.description: ID of the Trade's Take Profit Order, only provided if such an Order exists.
takeProfitOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

stopLossOrderID.description: ID of the Trade's Stop Loss Order, only provided if such an Order exists.
stopLossOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

trailingStopLossOrderID.description: ID of the Trade's Trailing Stop Loss Order, only provided if such an Order exists.
trailingStopLossOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

CalculatedTradeState.description: The dynamic (calculated) state of an open Trade

id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

unrealizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

WeeklyAlignment.description: The day of the week to use for candlestick granularities with weekly alignment.

time.description: The start time of the candlestick
time.format: A string conforming to RFC 3339 (https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt). The amount of sub-second precision provided may represent milliseconds (000 to 999), microseconds (000000 to 999999) or nanoseconds (000000000 to 999999999).

bid.description: The candlestick data based on bids. Only provided if bid-based candles were requested.

ask.description: The candlestick data based on asks. Only provided if ask-based candles were requested.

mid.description: The candlestick data based on midpoints. Only provided if midpoint-based candles were requested.

volume.description: The number of prices created during the time-range represented by the candlestick.

complete.description: A flag indicating if the candlestick is complete. A complete candlestick is one whose ending time is not in the future.

CandlestickData.description: The price data (open, high, low, close) for the Candlestick representation.

o.description: The first (open) price in the time-range represented by the candlestick.
o.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

h.description: The highest price in the time-range represented by the candlestick.
h.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

l.description: The lowest price in the time-range represented by the candlestick.
l.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

c.description: The last (closing) price in the time-range represented by the candlestick.
c.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Price's Instrument.

transactionIDPathParam.name: transactionID
transactionIDPathParam.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

userSpecifierPathParam.name: userSpecifier
userSpecifierPathParam.format: A user specifier may have one of 3 formats: the OANDA-assigned User ID (numerical), the client-provided username prefixed by the "@" symbol (e.g. "@myusername"), or the "@" symbol. The "@" symbol on its own acts as an alias for the username of the user accessing the endpoint (as inferred from the token provided).

orderSpecifierPathParam.name: orderSpecifier
orderSpecifierPathParam.format: Either the Order's OANDA-assigned OrderID or the Order's client-provided ClientID prefixed by the "@" symbol

tradeSpecifierPathParam.name: tradeSpecifier
tradeSpecifierPathParam.format: Either the Trade's OANDA-assigned TradeID or the Trade's client-provided ClientID prefixed by the "@" symbol

authorizationHeaderParam.name: Authorization
authorizationHeaderParam.despcription: The authorization bearer token previously obtained by the client
authorizationHeaderParam.format: The string 'Bearer ' followed by the token.

instrumentNamePathParam.name: instrument
instrumentNamePathParam.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

400.description: Bad Request. The client has provided invalid data to be processed by the server.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.

401.description: Unauthorized. The endpoint being access required the client to authenticated, however the the authentication token is invalid or has not been provided.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.

403.description: Forbidden. The client has provided a token that does not authorize them to perform the action implemented by teh API endpoint.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.

404.description: Not Found. The client has attempted to access an entity that does not exist.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.

405.description: Method Not Allowed. The client has attempted to access an endpoint using an HTTP method that is not supported.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.

416.description: Range Not Satisfiable. The client has specified a range that is invalid or cannot be processed.

errorCode.description: The code of the error that has occurred. This field may not be returned for some errors.

errorMessage.description: The human-readable description of the error that has occurred.
